newsitem.title: UK: UK Labour says confidence vote a possibility.
newsitem.headline: UK Labour says confidence vote a possibility.

text.p: The British opposition Labour Party's chief parliamentary manager Donald Dewar said on Monday the party may put down a motion of no confidence in the government if Prime Minister John Major loses a Commons vote later on Monday.
"I think we will meet that when we come to it. But it is certainly a possibility," Dewar told reporters.
Dewar said, however, he was not certain of winning Monday night's vote on fisheries policy.
The government lost a similar vote last year but ignored the result. However, the government has lost its majority and is now on level pegging with all the opposition parties.

"It's up to the smaller parties. If they support us, then it will be very close," Dewar said. Some of the smaller parties, in particular those from Northern Ireland, have been demanding concessions from the government in return for their support.
"We believe (the government) is time exhausted, time expired and it is in the public interest that it should go," he said.
